intro: Cyclostemon malabaricus, commonly known as the Malabar cyclostemon, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
